avalancheActivity.comment:
Since Saturday the wind has been moderate to strong. In gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain the wind slabs have increased in size.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with each other and the old snowpack. They can be released by a single winter sport participant.
The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. Backcountry touring calls for careful route selection.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In some localities light snowfall to above 1000 m.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack. The fresh snow of the last few days as well as the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 15 to 25 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 1500 m. The new snow can be released naturally in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Some snow fell in the last few days.
New snow and wind slabs can in some cases be released, in particular by large loads.
Small to medium-sized dry avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow represents the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: 25 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Friday above approximately 1600 m. In isolated cases new snow is lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area some new snow to above approximately 1000 m. Several small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry avalanches are possible.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Down to 1000 m snow has fallen over a wide area.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow has fallen since Friday. Over a wide area thus far only a little snow is lying.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust. These avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise. Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.
